bradleyross.library.helpers

Class FileHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • bradleyross.library.helpers.FileHelpers

  • public class FileHelpers
extends Object
    Methods to read and write files designed to be used within other programs.

    Note: SocketTimeoutException is a subclass of IOException.

    Note: Using the URLConnection.setReadTimeout(int) and URLConnection.setConnectTimeout(int) methods should prevent the methods in this class from hanging.

    It looks like the best approach is to rerun the process if an error occurs. Start with small timeout values and increase them on each iteration.

    Author:
    Bradley Ross

      • readTextFile

        public static String readTextFile(String name)

        Reads the contents of a text file into a String object given the name of the file.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Contents of file
        Throws:

      • readTextFile

        public static String readTextFile(URL address)
                           throws IOException
        Read the contents referenced by a URL into a String object.

        The java.net.URL object required as a parameter is created by a call of the type java.net.URL url = new java.net.URL(urlString) where urlString is a String object containing the URL identifier.

        This should only be used for text files. Results are unpredictable and probably undesirable when working with binary files.

        • ftp: ftp://userid:password@host:port/file

        • file: file:// (file name starting with / indicating root)

        Parameters:
        address - URL of desired contents
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        IOException

      • sendBytes

        public static void sendBytes(URL address,
             byte[] data)
                      throws IOException
        Write the contents of a byte array to a URL as a binary data stream.

        It appears that you can write to protocol ftp but not to protocol file.

        Parameters:
        address - URL of destination
        data - Byte array to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException
        SocketTimeoutException
        See Also:
        URLConnection

      • sendBytes

             File data)
                      throws IOException
        Write the contents of a file to a URL, passing the data as a byte stream (binary data).
        Parameters:
        address - URL of destination
        data - File object containing data to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getBytes

        public static void getBytes(URL url,
            File file)
                     throws IOException
        Read the contents of a URL into a file, passing the data as byte (binary) stream.

        In case of failure, the algorithm retries with increased values of connectTimeout and readTimeout.

        This modification may eventually be added to the other methods.

        Parameters:
        url - Location of data to be read
        file - File where data is to be written
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        URLConnection.setReadTimeout(int), URLConnection.setConnectTimeout(int)

        Parameters:

        output - OutputStream object where data is to be written
        Throws:

      • lineSplitterSpaces

        public static String[] lineSplitterSpaces(String input)
        Split a line into tokens using spaces as the field separators.

        This method can be used as an example of processing regular expressions in Java.

        Parameters:
        input - Line to be split into tokens
        Returns:
        Array of strings containing the tokens.

      • lineSplitterCommas

        public static String[] lineSplitterCommas(String input)
        Split a line into tokens using commas as the field separators.

        The space is suffixed to the input parameter because the system doesn't seem to recognize a comma as the last character in the string as signifying a new token.

        Parameters:
        input - Line to be split into tokens
        Returns:
        Array of strings containing the tokens.
